sentences.sContent: The school trip has become an annual event.
sentences.sCn: 学校组织的旅行成了一年一度的活动。

sentences.sContent: ...The Consumer Technology Association is the sponsor of the annual Consumer Electronics Show...
...Chinese Academy of Sciences released a series of annual reports about its latest scientific findings and a blueprint for the coming year...
...The 7% growth annual goal demonstrates that the government is concentrating on the quality of life rather than the speed of growth...
...Spending on such "durables" dropped at a 12% annual rate in 2008's third quarter...
...fertiliser manufacturing consumes about 3-5% of the world's annual natural gas supply...
...the poet Ted Hughes sat on the judging panel of an annual poetry competition for British schoolchildren...
...Members of the global elite debated that unusual question at the annual World Economic Forum...
...Combine this fact with annual government threats to indiscriminately cut reimbursements...

synos.tran: 年刊，[图情]年鉴；一年生植物

phrases.pCn: 年报，年度报告；年度决算；年度财务报告
年营业额，年成交量；年总生物量

trans.tranCn: 年报， 年鉴； 一年生的植物
trans.tranOther: a plant that lives for one year or season
